com.codecool.shop.controller

Class ProductController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codecool.shop.controller.ProductController

  • public class ProductController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the actual user of the Database Access Objects. Collects all the required DAOs. It's responsible for the whole logic behind the webshop, and it's controls the flow of data between the user interface and the databse.

        public static spark.ModelAndView deleteItem(spark.Request req,
                                            spark.Response res)
        Deletes a line item from the user's cart.
        Returns:
        A Thymeleaf ModelAndView objects, the cart view page of the webshop.

      • editItem

        public static spark.ModelAndView editItem(spark.Request req,
                                          spark.Response res)
        Edits the quantity of the line item. If the quantity drops to 0, then the line item is deleted entirely.
        Returns:
        A Thymeleaf ModelAndView objects, the cart view page of the webshop.

      • login_user

        public static spark.ModelAndView login_user(spark.Request request,
                                            spark.Response response,
                                            org.hibernate.Session session)
        Logs in the user to the webshop. It uses the user email for querying, but only logs in the user, when her password is authenticated.
        Returns:
        A Thymeleaf ModelAndView objects, the main page of the webshop.

      • login

        public static spark.ModelAndView login(spark.Request request,

      • register_user

        public static spark.ModelAndView register_user(spark.Request request,
                                               spark.Response response,
                                               org.hibernate.Session session)
        Stores the registered user's data in the database. The password is hashed and salted before storing for security reasons.
        Returns:
        A Thymeleaf ModelAndView objects, the main page of the webshop.
